trans-unit.source: description: The {Binding} markup extension is converted at XAML load time into an instance of the Binding class.
trans-unit.target: description: The {Binding} markup extension is converted at XAML load time into an instance of the Binding class.

trans-unit.source: title: {Binding} markup extension' ms.assetid: 3BAFE7B5-AF33-487F-9AD5-BEAFD65D04C3
trans-unit.target: title: {Binding} markup extension' ms.assetid: 3BAFE7B5-AF33-487F-9AD5-BEAFD65D04C3

trans-unit.source: {Binding} markup extension
trans-unit.target: {Binding} markup extension

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: **Note** A new binding mechanism is available for Windows 10, which is optimized for performance and developer productivity.
trans-unit.target: **Note** A new binding mechanism is available for Windows 10, which is optimized for performance and developer productivity.

trans-unit.source: See [{x:Bind} markup extension](x-bind-markup-extension.md).
trans-unit.target: See [{x:Bind} markup extension](x-bind-markup-extension.md).

trans-unit.source: **Note** For general info about using data binding in your app with **{Binding}** (and for an all-up comparison between **{x:Bind}** and **{Binding}**), see [Data binding in depth](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210946).
trans-unit.target: **Note** For general info about using data binding in your app with **{Binding}** (and for an all-up comparison between **{x:Bind}** and **{Binding}**), see [Data binding in depth](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210946).

trans-unit.source: The **{Binding}** markup extension is converted at XAML load time into an instance of the [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) class.
trans-unit.target: The **{Binding}** markup extension is converted at XAML load time into an instance of the [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) class.

trans-unit.source: This binding object gets a value from a property on a data source.
trans-unit.target: This binding object gets a value from a property on a data source.

trans-unit.source: The binding object can optionally be configured to observe changes in the value of the data source property and refresh itself based on those changes.
trans-unit.target: The binding object can optionally be configured to observe changes in the value of the data source property and refresh itself based on those changes.

trans-unit.source: It can also optionally be configured to push changes in its own value back to the source property.
trans-unit.target: It can also optionally be configured to push changes in its own value back to the source property.

trans-unit.source: The property that is the target of a data binding must be a dependency property.
trans-unit.target: The property that is the target of a data binding must be a dependency property.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Dependency properties overview](dependency-properties-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Dependency properties overview](dependency-properties-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: **{Binding}** has the same dependency property precedence as a local value, and setting a local value in imperative code removes the effect of any **{Binding}** set in markup.
trans-unit.target: **{Binding}** has the same dependency property precedence as a local value, and setting a local value in imperative code removes the effect of any **{Binding}** set in markup.

trans-unit.source: Sample apps that demonstrate {Binding}
trans-unit.target: Sample apps that demonstrate {Binding}

trans-unit.source: Download the [Bookstore1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=532950) app.
trans-unit.target: Download the [Bookstore1](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=532950) app.

trans-unit.source: Download the [Bookstore2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=532952) app.
trans-unit.target: Download the [Bookstore2](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=532952) app.

trans-unit.source: XAML attribute usage
trans-unit.target: XAML attribute usage

trans-unit.source: Term
trans-unit.target: Term

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: propertyPath
trans-unit.target: propertyPath

trans-unit.source: A string that specifies the property path for the binding.
trans-unit.target: A string that specifies the property path for the binding.

trans-unit.source: More info is in the [Property path](#property-path) section below.
trans-unit.target: More info is in the [Property path](#property-path) section below.

trans-unit.source: bindingProperties
trans-unit.target: bindingProperties

trans-unit.source: *propName*=*value*\[, *propName*=*value*
trans-unit.target: *propName*=*value*\[, *propName*=*value*

trans-unit.source: One or more binding properties that are specified using a name/value pair syntax.
trans-unit.target: One or more binding properties that are specified using a name/value pair syntax.

trans-unit.source: propName
trans-unit.target: propName

trans-unit.source: The string name of the property to set on the [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) object.
trans-unit.target: The string name of the property to set on the [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) object.

trans-unit.source: For example, "Converter".
trans-unit.target: For example, "Converter".

trans-unit.source: value
trans-unit.target: value

trans-unit.source: The value to set the property to.
trans-unit.target: The value to set the property to.

trans-unit.source: The syntax of the argument depends on the property of [Properties of the Binding class that can be set with {Binding}](#properties-of-binding) section below.
trans-unit.target: The syntax of the argument depends on the property of [Properties of the Binding class that can be set with {Binding}](#properties-of-binding) section below.

trans-unit.source: Property path
trans-unit.target: Property path

trans-unit.source: *PropertyPath* sets the value of [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830), which is the property that you're binding to (the source property).
trans-unit.target: *PropertyPath* sets the value of [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830), which is the property that you're binding to (the source property).

trans-unit.source: You can mention the property name explicitly: `{Binding Path=...}`.
trans-unit.target: You can mention the property name explicitly: `{Binding Path=...}`.

trans-unit.source: Or you can omit it: `{Binding ...}`.
trans-unit.target: Or you can omit it: `{Binding ...}`.

trans-unit.source: The type of [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830) is a property path, which is a string that evaluates to a property or sub-property of either your custom type or a framework type.
trans-unit.target: The type of [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830) is a property path, which is a string that evaluates to a property or sub-property of either your custom type or a framework type.

trans-unit.source: The type can be, but does not need to be, a [**DependencyObject**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242356).
trans-unit.target: The type can be, but does not need to be, a [**DependencyObject**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242356).

trans-unit.source: Steps in a property path are delimited by dots (.), and you can include multiple delimiters to traverse successive sub-properties.
trans-unit.target: Steps in a property path are delimited by dots (.), and you can include multiple delimiters to traverse successive sub-properties.

trans-unit.source: Use the dot delimiter regardless of the programming language used to implement the object being bound to.
trans-unit.target: Use the dot delimiter regardless of the programming language used to implement the object being bound to.

trans-unit.source: For example, to bind UI to an employee object's first name property, your property path might be "Employee.FirstName".
trans-unit.target: For example, to bind UI to an employee object's first name property, your property path might be "Employee.FirstName".

trans-unit.source: If you are binding an items control to a property that contains an employee's dependents, your property path might be "Employee.Dependents", and the item template of the items control would take care of displaying the items in "Dependents".
trans-unit.target: If you are binding an items control to a property that contains an employee's dependents, your property path might be "Employee.Dependents", and the item template of the items control would take care of displaying the items in "Dependents".

trans-unit.source: If the data source is a collection, then a property path can specify items in the collection by their position or index.
trans-unit.target: If the data source is a collection, then a property path can specify items in the collection by their position or index.

trans-unit.source: For example, "Teams\[0\].Players", where the literal "\[\]" encloses the "0" that specifies the first item in a collection.
trans-unit.target: For example, "Teams\[0\].Players", where the literal "\[\]" encloses the "0" that specifies the first item in a collection.

trans-unit.source: When using an [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828) binding to an existing [**DependencyObject**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242356), you can use attached properties as part of the property path.
trans-unit.target: When using an [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828) binding to an existing [**DependencyObject**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242356), you can use attached properties as part of the property path.

trans-unit.source: To disambiguate an attached property so that the intermediate dot in the attached property name is not considered a step into a property path, put parentheses around the owner-qualified attached property name; for example, `(AutomationProperties.Name)`.
trans-unit.target: To disambiguate an attached property so that the intermediate dot in the attached property name is not considered a step into a property path, put parentheses around the owner-qualified attached property name; for example, `(AutomationProperties.Name)`.

trans-unit.source: A property path intermediate object is stored as a [**PropertyPath**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244259) object in a run-time representation, but most scenarios won't need to interact with a **PropertyPath** object in code.
trans-unit.target: A property path intermediate object is stored as a [**PropertyPath**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244259) object in a run-time representation, but most scenarios won't need to interact with a **PropertyPath** object in code.

trans-unit.source: You can usually specify the binding info you need using XAML.
trans-unit.target: You can usually specify the binding info you need using XAML.

trans-unit.source: For more info about the string syntax for a property path, property paths in animation feature areas, and constructing a [**PropertyPath**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244259) object, see [Property-path syntax](property-path-syntax.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info about the string syntax for a property path, property paths in animation feature areas, and constructing a [**PropertyPath**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244259) object, see [Property-path syntax](property-path-syntax.md).

trans-unit.source: Properties of the Binding class that can be set with {Binding}
trans-unit.target: Properties of the Binding class that can be set with {Binding}

trans-unit.source: **{Binding}** is illustrated with the *bindingProperties* placeholder syntax because there are multiple read/write properties of a [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) that can be set in the markup extension.
trans-unit.target: **{Binding}** is illustrated with the *bindingProperties* placeholder syntax because there are multiple read/write properties of a [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) that can be set in the markup extension.

trans-unit.source: The properties can be set in any order with comma-separated *propName*=*value* pairs.
trans-unit.target: The properties can be set in any order with comma-separated *propName*=*value* pairs.

trans-unit.source: Some of the properties require types that don't have a type conversion, so these require markup extensions of their own nested within the **{Binding}**.
trans-unit.target: Some of the properties require types that don't have a type conversion, so these require markup extensions of their own nested within the **{Binding}**.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Path
trans-unit.target: Path

trans-unit.source: See the [Property path](#property-path) section above.
trans-unit.target: See the [Property path](#property-path) section above.

trans-unit.source: Converter
trans-unit.target: Converter

trans-unit.source: Specifies the converter object that is called by the binding engine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the converter object that is called by the binding engine.

trans-unit.source: The converter can be set in XAML, but only if you refer to an object instance that you've assigned in a [{StaticResource} markup extension](staticresource-markup-extension.md) reference to that object in the resource dictionary.
trans-unit.target: The converter can be set in XAML, but only if you refer to an object instance that you've assigned in a [{StaticResource} markup extension](staticresource-markup-extension.md) reference to that object in the resource dictionary.

trans-unit.source: ConverterLanguage
trans-unit.target: ConverterLanguage

trans-unit.source: Specifies the culture to be used by the converter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the culture to be used by the converter.

trans-unit.source: (If you're setting [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826).) The culture is set as a standards-based identifier.
trans-unit.target: (If you're setting [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826).) The culture is set as a standards-based identifier.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see **ConverterLanguage**
trans-unit.target: For more info, see **ConverterLanguage**

trans-unit.source: ConverterParameter
trans-unit.target: ConverterParameter

trans-unit.source: Specifies the converter parameter that can be used in converter logic.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the converter parameter that can be used in converter logic.

trans-unit.source: (If you're setting [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826).) Most converters use simple logic that get all the info they need from the passed value to convert, and don't need a **ConverterParameter** value.
trans-unit.target: (If you're setting [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826).) Most converters use simple logic that get all the info they need from the passed value to convert, and don't need a **ConverterParameter** value.

trans-unit.source: The **ConverterParameter** parameter is for moderately advanced converter implementations that have more than one logic that keys off what's passed in **ConverterParameter**.
trans-unit.target: The **ConverterParameter** parameter is for moderately advanced converter implementations that have more than one logic that keys off what's passed in **ConverterParameter**.

trans-unit.source: You can write a converter that uses values other than strings but this is uncommon, see Remarks in **ConverterParameter** for more info.
trans-unit.target: You can write a converter that uses values other than strings but this is uncommon, see Remarks in **ConverterParameter** for more info.

trans-unit.source: ElementName
trans-unit.target: ElementName

trans-unit.source: Specifies a data source by referencing another element in the same XAML construct that has a **Name** property or [x:Name attribute](x-name-attribute.md).
trans-unit.target: Specifies a data source by referencing another element in the same XAML construct that has a **Name** property or [x:Name attribute](x-name-attribute.md).

trans-unit.source: This is often use to share related values or use sub-properties of one UI element to provide a specific value for another element, for example in a XAML control template.
trans-unit.target: This is often use to share related values or use sub-properties of one UI element to provide a specific value for another element, for example in a XAML control template.

trans-unit.source: FallbackValue
trans-unit.target: FallbackValue

trans-unit.source: Specifies a value to display when the source or path cannot be resolved.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a value to display when the source or path cannot be resolved.

trans-unit.source: Mode
trans-unit.target: Mode

trans-unit.source: Specifies the binding mode, as one of these strings: "OneTime", "OneWay", or "TwoWay".
trans-unit.target: Specifies the binding mode, as one of these strings: "OneTime", "OneWay", or "TwoWay".

trans-unit.source: These correspond to the constant names of the [**BindingMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209822) enumeration.
trans-unit.target: These correspond to the constant names of the [**BindingMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209822) enumeration.

trans-unit.source: The default depends on the binding target but in most cases it is "OneWay".
trans-unit.target: The default depends on the binding target but in most cases it is "OneWay".

trans-unit.source: Note that this differs from the default for **{x:Bind}**, which is "OneTime".
trans-unit.target: Note that this differs from the default for **{x:Bind}**, which is "OneTime".

trans-unit.source: RelativeSource
trans-unit.target: RelativeSource

trans-unit.source: Specifies a data source by describing the position of the binding source relative to the position of the binding target.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a data source by describing the position of the binding source relative to the position of the binding target.

trans-unit.source: This is expressed in terms of the run-time object graph, for example specifying the object's parent.
trans-unit.target: This is expressed in terms of the run-time object graph, for example specifying the object's parent.

trans-unit.source: Setting the [{RelativeSource} markup extension](relativesource-markup-extension.md).
trans-unit.target: Setting the [{RelativeSource} markup extension](relativesource-markup-extension.md).

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: Specifies the object data source.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the object data source.

trans-unit.source: Within the **Binding** markup extension, the [Data binding in depth](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210946).
trans-unit.target: Within the **Binding** markup extension, the [Data binding in depth](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210946).

trans-unit.source: TargetNullValue
trans-unit.target: TargetNullValue

trans-unit.source: Specifies a value to display when the source value resolves but is explicitly **null**.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a value to display when the source value resolves but is explicitly **null**.

trans-unit.source: UpdateSourceTrigger
trans-unit.target: UpdateSourceTrigger

trans-unit.source: Specifies the timing of binding source updates.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the timing of binding source updates.

trans-unit.source: If unspecified, the default is **Default**.
trans-unit.target: If unspecified, the default is **Default**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you're converting markup from **{x:Bind}** to **{Binding}**, then be aware of the differences in default values for the **Mode** property.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you're converting markup from **{x:Bind}** to **{Binding}**, then be aware of the differences in default values for the **Mode** property.

trans-unit.source: [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826), [**ConverterLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701880) and **ConverterLanguage** are all related to the scenario of converting a value or type from the binding source into a type or value that is compatible with the binding target property.
trans-unit.target: [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826), [**ConverterLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701880) and **ConverterLanguage** are all related to the scenario of converting a value or type from the binding source into a type or value that is compatible with the binding target property.

trans-unit.source: For more info and examples, see the "Data conversions" section of [Data binding in depth](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210946).
trans-unit.target: For more info and examples, see the "Data conversions" section of [Data binding in depth](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt210946).

trans-unit.source: [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209832), [**RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209831), and [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828) specify a binding source, so they are mutually exclusive.
trans-unit.target: [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209832), [**RelativeSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209831), and [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828) specify a binding source, so they are mutually exclusive.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** If you need to specify a single curly brace for a value, such as in [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830) or [**ConverterParameter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209827), then precede it with a backslash: `\{`.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** If you need to specify a single curly brace for a value, such as in [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830) or [**ConverterParameter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209827), then precede it with a backslash: `\{`.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, enclose the entire string that contains the braces that need escaping in a secondary quotation set, for example `ConverterParameter='{Mix}'`.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, enclose the entire string that contains the braces that need escaping in a secondary quotation set, for example `ConverterParameter='{Mix}'`.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: The second example sets four different [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) properties: [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828), [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830), [**Mode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209829) and [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826).
trans-unit.target: The second example sets four different [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820) properties: [**ElementName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209828), [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830), [**Mode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209829) and [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826).

trans-unit.source: **Path** in this case is shown explicitly named as a **Binding** property.
trans-unit.target: **Path** in this case is shown explicitly named as a **Binding** property.

trans-unit.source: The **Path** is evaluated to a data binding source that is another object in the same run-time object tree, a [**Slider**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209614) named `sliderValueConverter`.
trans-unit.target: The **Path** is evaluated to a data binding source that is another object in the same run-time object tree, a [**Slider**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209614) named `sliderValueConverter`.

trans-unit.source: Note how the [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826) property value uses another markup extension, [{StaticResource} markup extension](staticresource-markup-extension.md), so there are two nested markup extension usages here.
trans-unit.target: Note how the [**Converter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209826) property value uses another markup extension, [{StaticResource} markup extension](staticresource-markup-extension.md), so there are two nested markup extension usages here.

trans-unit.source: The inner one is evaluated first, so that once the resource is obtained there's a practical [**IValueConverter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209903) (a custom class that's instantiated by the `local:S2Formatter` element in resources) that the binding can use.
trans-unit.target: The inner one is evaluated first, so that once the resource is obtained there's a practical [**IValueConverter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209903) (a custom class that's instantiated by the `local:S2Formatter` element in resources) that the binding can use.

trans-unit.source: Tools support
trans-unit.target: Tools support

trans-unit.source: Microsoft IntelliSense in Microsoft Visual Studio displays the properties of the data context while authoring **{Binding}** in the XAML markup editor.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft IntelliSense in Microsoft Visual Studio displays the properties of the data context while authoring **{Binding}** in the XAML markup editor.

trans-unit.source: As soon as you type "{Binding", data context properties appropriate for [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830) are displayed in the dropdown.
trans-unit.target: As soon as you type "{Binding", data context properties appropriate for [**Path**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209830) are displayed in the dropdown.

trans-unit.source: IntelliSense also helps with the other properties of [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820).
trans-unit.target: IntelliSense also helps with the other properties of [**Binding**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209820).

trans-unit.source: For this to work, you must have either the data context or the design-time data context set in the markup page.
trans-unit.target: For this to work, you must have either the data context or the design-time data context set in the markup page.

trans-unit.source: **Go To Definition** (F12) also works with **{Binding}**.
trans-unit.target: **Go To Definition** (F12) also works with **{Binding}**.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the data binding dialog.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the data binding dialog.
